title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-8.1 - Quarterly financial reports

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-8.1 - Quarterly financial reports

State Regulations

Unless the division shall otherwise request, the
requirement to submit monthly financial reports consisting of a uniform balance
sheet and a schedule of investments (see §
1646-7.1
) shall cease when the
project has been declared substantially completed. The requirement to submit
quarterly financial reports (see §
1646-7.2
) within 15 days after the
end of each calendar quarter shall, however, continue beyond the date of
substantial completion into the operating period. Each quarterly financial
report submitted subsequent to the date of substantial completion shall
include, in addition to the data and schedules prescribed in Table I of section
1646-7.2
and such supplementary
schedules listed in Table II of section
1646-7.2
as are required by the
division to be submitted, a statement of income and expense of the project
proper on form DH-621, Income and Expense--Budget Control Statement, in an
original and a duplicate, form DH-621 shall be numbered schedule No. 13 of the
quarterly financial report. Quarterly financial reports for the quarter ending

March 31, beginning with the year in which the date of substantial completion
falls, shall further include, in an original and duplicate, a reconciliation of
reserve fund and reserve accounts (see §
1647-5.5
) and a schedule of
replacement reserve transactions (see §
1647-4.9
) which shall be numbered
schedules no. 14 and no. 15, respectively of the report. Notes
